name: Jie Zhang 0059
content: Jie Zhang - Queen's University Belfast View Scopus Profile Jie Zhang Dr Lecturer, School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Emailjie.zhangqub.acuk Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectsOpen to PhD applications in the fields of: AI for next-generation wireless systems; wireless sensing and communications for healthcare. 20202025 Research activity per year Personal profile ParticularsJie Zhang is currently a Lecturer (Assistant Professor) at the Centre for Wireless Innovation (CWI), School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Queen’s University Belfast, U.K. From 2022 to 2024, he was a Marie Curie Research Fellow at the University of Leeds, U.K. He was an Associate Professor at the University of Science and Technology Beijing, China, in 2022. From 2019 to 2021, he was a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the Peking University, China. His main research interests include intelligent sensing, wireless systems, AIoT, wearable computing, and machine learning, etc. He has authored and co-authored over 70 papers in peer-reviewed journals and conferences. Jie Zhang is always looking for self-motivated candidates with strong mathematical and programming backgrounds to conduct Ph.D. research in the fields of AI for next-generation wireless systems, and wireless sensing and communications for healthcare. If you are interested in these areas, please feel free to contact [email protected]. Research InterestsIntelligent sensingWireless systemsAIoTWearable computingSmart healthMachine learningTeachingCSC1033 Introduction to Computer ArchitectureCSC3058 Advanced Computer Architecture Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
